section.name: Welcome to Aozan
section.p: Aozan has been developed in order to automatically handle raw data transfer, demultiplexing and quality control of a sequencing run once a HiSeq or Nextseq run has been completed. This software is involved in the primary data analysis. Aozan produces compressed FASTQ files and a quality report from an HiSeq or Nextseq sequencer output in order to evaluate each sequencing parameter. Aozan can work on most computer infrastructures and only requires a samplesheet for each run.
Aozan greatly helps to improve the efficiency in the run data management and to keep tracks of the run statistics through automatic mails and HTML report pages.

img.alt: Example on quality control run report

section.name: Supported devices
section.p: Aozan can handle the output of many Illumina sequencer models, however not all the models of Illumina sequencers has been tested with Aozan. As Illumina sequencer outputs are very similar, Aozan may work with most of the Illumina sequencers. You can contact us to tell us if your sequencer model is compatible with Aozan.

section.name: Sample sheet validator
section.p: We also provide a Bcl2fastq samplesheet validator to help the users in checking their run samplesheet. This tool uses only html and javascript. Not a single data is sent to our servers when you use this tool.

subsection.name: bcl2fastq 2.18 in Aozan
subsection.p: Aozan now supports bcl2fastq 2.18

subsection.name: Aozan can now fully be executed using a Docker image.
subsection.p: Aozan can now fully be executed using a Docker image. Thus you don't need to install all dependancies on your computer before using it.

subsection.name: New built-in step to automatically recompress all your fastq files.
subsection.p: Aozan has now a new built-in step which recompresses fastq and fastq-gzip files into fastq-bzip2 files. bzip2 files are more compressed than gzip files and thus take less disk space. They also are compatible with hadoop since they are chunked files. Please check here.

subsection.name: Define denied runs and prioritized runs and automatically deny runs in error
subsection.p: In the aozan.var.path, you can specify [step].deny file (qc.deny, demux.deny, ...). Runs specified in these files won't be processed by the step. In the aozan.var.path, you can also specify runs.priority file. Runs specified in this file are processed in priority by aozan when available Furthermore, on detection of a run in error, automatically add it to hiseq.deny

subsection.name: Easy samplesheet auto usage
subsection.p: Aozan can now automatically check and use a samplesheet when available in run root folder if no samplesheet is given in input.

subsection.name: True Illumina values for metrics like phasing and prephasing
subsection.p: Phasing/prephasing values are now extracted directly from Illumina InterOps binary files. Thus gives exactly the same values as sequencers.

subsection.name: Choose the number of mismatch for demultiplexing
subsection.p: Samplesheet can now contain the number of allowed mismatch for demultiplexing

subsection.name: Aozan 2.0 manage HiSeq and NextSeq sequencers
subsection.p: Aozan can manage several sequencers, and now handles the latest versions of illumina sequencers (HiSeq and NextSeq).

subsection.name: bcl2fastq 2 software management
subsection.p: bcl2fastq version 2 deals with the data demultiplexing from Hiseq or either NextSeq runs. Aozan can manage the new sample sheet file format from bcl2fastq version 2.

subsection.name: Demultiplexing using docker
subsection.p: Aozan can run the demultiplexing step using a bcl2fastq 2 docker image. bcl2fastq 2 images are available on our dockerhub.

subsection.name: FastQC version 0.11.3
subsection.p: Aozan now uses FastQC version 0.11.3. Aozan still contains previous Aozan enhancements to FastQC (the "Bad tiles" module and the optional blast in the "Overrepresented sequences" module).

subsection.name: Analysis of the indices of reads in the undetermined FASTQ files
subsection.p: Aozan now provide a QC module that analyzes indices of reads in the undetermined FASTQ files. For each indices, this module suggest the sample(s) and the number of reads that can be recovered using a demultiplexing step with one more mismatch that the number of mismatches has been used. See for more information about this feature the sample tests section of the documentation.
The reports generated by this module show for each sample, the list of indices and read counts that can be recovered.

img.alt: the sample report html for recovering clusters

subsection.name: FastQC and contamination dectection on undetermined FASTQ files
subsection.p: Two parameters have been added in the Aozan configuration file to run FastQC and contamination detection on the undetermined FASTQ files. For this module, all available genomes related to the run are used for contamination detection.

subsection.name: Using Aozan in multi-servers context
subsection.p: The Aozan configuration file has been improved with a new "include" directive. With this enhancement, it will be easier to use Aozan in a multi-servers context using the same core configuration file by all Aozan instances.

subsection.name: Enhancements to FastQC
subsection.p: The control quality steps contains an additional FastQC module named "Bad tiles" that search tiles with BMS (Bottom Middle Swath) issues with Illumina flowcell v3.

Optionally, Aozan adds a sub-step in FastQC to enhance the Overrepresented sequences module. For sequences with "no hit", a blastn can be launch to estimate the source. Blastn results with 100% identity and 0% gap will be included in report.

img.alt: module overrepresented sequences with results from blastn

subsection.name: Contamination detection with FastQ-Screen
subsection.p: Aozan now include a fast Java FastQ Screen implementation. This module maps reads samples on a list of reference genomes for assessing sample contamination and the ratio of the expected genome in the sample. It creates a report file with values for each genome.

subsection.name: Reading Illumina InterOp binary files
subsection.p: Run data are now retrieved by parsing Illumina InterOp Binary Metric files as Illumina XML run files are now deprecated.

img.alt: example on report with run data

subsection.name: Continuous synchronization of HiSeq data
subsection.p: Aozan can now perform continuous synchronizations of working runs to avoid a big synchronizations at the end of the runs.
